intro: Fumana thymifolia subsp. barrelieri, commonly known as the Barrelier's thyme-leaved fumana, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small, often gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in some areas.
